tests.explanation: The original program correctly reverses the digits of the input number N twice, once using arithmetic and once using string concatenation. The mutant program changes the stopping condition of the first while loop to N != 10 instead of N != 0, causing it to miss the last digit of the input. Therefore, the mutant program reverses the first two digits correctly but outputs the original input number followed by the reversed substring.
Both programs correctly handle the case where the input is 0.
Both programs correctly handle the case where the input has nine digits.
